intro: Lidia biflora, commonly known as the two-flowered lidia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or partially shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
